about.intro: Mirlo provides a user-friendly space to help artists sell digital music, receive financial support, manage mailing lists, and share with their supporters.
about.missionStatement: <1>The music industry does not work for artists or listeners and needs a radical re-imagining.<2>Mirlo hosts a community of artists, listeners, organizers, and coders who are daring to do just that: taking lessons learned from working in the solidarity economy and applying them to our platform.</1><1>We are building an online audio distribution and patronage platform that aims to be radical, accessible, open source (free & libre), modular, and standards based.</1>
about.featuresText:
Mirlo provides a space for artists to upload their music, establish their online presence, sell their music, and receive ongoing monthly contributions from their audience.

For a thorough look at our features for artists, check out our features page.
about.pricingText:
Artists get to decide how much of their sale goes to Mirlo. They do this by setting a percentage on sales. So if an artist sells an album on for $10, they will decide whether Mirlo gets 70 cents, $1, or nothing. This lets artists decide how much of their money they need for themselves. By default, Mirlo charges 10% on each sale. Then, our payment processor Stripe, will take a cut of 2.9% + 30c (proportionally this is larger on small transactions).

Want to know more about our thought process? Check out our blog post explaining how we got there.

As we develop our project and come to terms with the costs of running it, we will adjust these numbers and explore new ways of financing Mirlo.
about.morePricing: As we develop our project and come to terms with costs of running it, we will tweak these numbers and explore new ways of paying for the service and our work.

platformSlider.howMuchModalText: Mirlo thrives on artist contributions—whether through monthly support or a slice of album sales. But we get it: every cent counts, and only you know what you can afford. That’s why we let you decide how much of your sales goes to Mirlo. Your art, your call.

manageAlbum.allowMirloPromoLabel: Allow Mirlo to use it for promotion?
manageAlbum.isGettable: Is it possible for a user to buy or download this album?
manageAlbum.isGettableTooltip: We don't want to take this for granted! Some musicians just want to share their music, but don't want to let people download it.
manageAlbum.isGettableInfo: Disabling this will make it so that users can't buy or download your album, but they can listen to it online for free. Most people will want to leave this enabled.
manageAlbum.currencyIsSetOnManageArtist: The currency is set by the payment processor you've linked on the manage artist page.
manageAlbum.allowMirloPromo: Allow Mirlo's <hype>Hype Circle</hype> to use these tracks for promotional material of the platform. You will be credited, and can set this for individual tracks.

manageAlbum.whatMeanLicense: Don't know what this means? It's safe to leave it blank. Depending on your country, your work is most likely already copyrighted under the Berne Convention and/or the TRIPS agreement (more about it here).

trackGroupEmbed.copyIframe: If you want to embed the track in another website, copy the code below:

home.support: <red>Directly support artists.</red> Buy their music. Collectively owned and managed.
home.sustainedBy: Mirlo's work is sustained by our community, not by venture capital.
home.featuresLink: What is Mirlo? Check out <features>our features</features> and <about>about section</about>.
home.mirloConstruction:
Wanna talk more? E-mail us, join our Discord, or join us for office hours! Also check out our About page, and the code on GitHub.

Want to just receive our monthly newsletter? Sign up
home.supportUs: Want to support us as we grow Mirlo? <support>Pitch in</support>
